newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ayala 1996 net seen at 6 bln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Ayala 1996 net seen at 6 bln pesos.

text.p: Diversified firm Ayala Corp's announcement on Wednesday of a 32 percent rise in net profits to 4.95 billion pesos in the first nine months led to expectations full year profits would be over six billion pesos.
The firm, which has subsidiaries in banking, insurance, food, real estate and telecommunications, did not give the comparative year-ago nine month figure.
An analyst at Guoco Securities (Phil) Inc said he expected the conglomerate to generate 6.2 billion pesos in profits for the full year.
In 1995, Ayala Corp reported net profit of 5,483 million pesos.
Dharmala Securities Philippines Inc said it expected Ayala Corp's full year net at 6.1 billion pesos.
Another brokerage, Pryce Securities, said Ayala Corp will most likely make net profit of 6.11 billion pesos for 1996.
"Ayala Corp will likely meet a 30 percent increase in profit by yearend," said Noel Reyes, research head at Anscor Hagedorn Securities Inc.

"Strong performance of Ayala Land and BPI will enable the company to withstand the losses of its other subsidiaries, Globe Telecom and Pure Foods," said Jonas Ferrer, research director at Pryce Securities Inc.
Ayala Land is the firm's real estate unit and BPI (Bank of Philippine Islands) is its banking flagship.
Ayala Land posted a 34 percent hike in net income while BPI's earnings jumped 69 percent for the first nine months.
Its cellular phone firm Globe Telecom recorded a ninon pesos.

Its food unit, Pure Foods Corp's leadership in the meats and flour milling business was weighed down by an industry-wide supply glut in the poultry business, analysts said. - Katherine Espina (632) 841 8939
